title: Digital Assistant Merchandiser
content:
Key Duties/Responsibilities:
 

Produce trading summaries to present them in the trade meetings and share with the Digital Trading and Marketing teams.
Attend trade meetings for your assigned countries and present trade and product information, answer questions from the teams (mostly via Microsoft Teams or other Video Call software)
Monitor email and work live chats constantly to pick up any product or trade requests or answer questions from your assigned countries’ teams.


Work closely with core merchandising and buyers to get the best out of the stock and ranges that are getting back as a business.


Work closely with the channel teams (CRM, Social, Paid Media, Affiliates etc) providing data-driven product pushes and new ideas on how to drive sales for your market.
Creating links (product lists) based on market trends, search analysis, selecting outfits for mailers/campaigns.
Check the sites throughout the day to raise any potential issues – broken links, incorrect product descriptions, product placement, imagery, and general housekeeping.
Carrying out detailed site reviews and making recommendations for change to International Teams, using the JD UK website as a reference and the manager and the team’s knowledge.
Evaluate, fix or flag to relevant parties (tech support, merchandisers and managers) any product-related issues raised by Digital or central Buying and Merchandising teams.
Visual merchandising of product list pages using the merchandising tool Fred Hopper.
Analysing reports to understand good and poor performance and relaying this information on to relevant parties.
Assist the Senior merchandiser with other day-to-day jobs and requests.

 
Teamwork

Reporting to Multi-Channel International Senior Merchandiser and Merchandising Manager
Establish close working relationships with Multi-Channel International and International Marketing teams, and with the JD UK Multi-Channel merchandising team.
Communicate with the core Buying & Merchandise teams

 
Key Deliverables
 

Assist the Digital Senior Merchandisers and Trading teams to drive the assigned channels and deliver agreed sales and profitability targets.
Apply best practice and ensure all rules and guidelines are always respected, also by the wider teams.
Build strong relationships with central (‘core’) Buying & Merchandising teams.
Identify opportunities.
Identify threats and propose creative solutions.
Become expert in the use of online systems/tools, e.g., Fred Hopper and Google Analytics.

 
Skills needed
 

Ecommerce, merchandising and good knowledge of excel.
Experience working with ecommerce merchandiser software.
Fast and adaptable learning, e.g., to learn new systems / software and new processes.
Strong organisation and time-management skills.
Commercial brand awareness.
Strong analytical skills and a keen eye for detail.
Strong communication and work well in a team.

 
 
The Company:
The JD Group is a leading omnichannel retailer of Sports Fashion, Street & Premium Fashion, Outdoors and Gyms with over 60,000 colleagues over 3,400 stores across several retail fascia's in over 30 markets around the world.
We are an equal opportunities employer who embraces and values differences. We recognise the importance of an inclusive workplace culture in which everyone can thrive irrespective of their background or identity.
To be a part of this successful and continuously growing company, you will have the desire to ingrain our strategic goals of being a people first, a digital leader and customer focused organisation which provides operational excellence and is continuous with identifying new areas of growth into our day-to-day.
We know our employees work tirelessly to make JD Sports the success it is today and in turn, we offer them some amazing benefits:

Incremental Holiday Allowance
Staff Discount on qualifying purchases across Group retail stores and online
Exclusive Colleague Bike Discount scheme
Discounted Gym membership
Personal development opportunities to learn and develop at work
Access to Apprenticeships and accredited qualifications

Interested? 
If you are interested in this position, then press the Apply Now button.
Due to the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it takes time to review them all. If you don't hear back within two weeks of your application, please consider your application to have been unsuccessful on this occasion
Applications that meet the skills criteria will be contacted for a 1st stage meeting with the talent team. Shortlisted candidates will then be invited to interview with the hiring manager.
Thank you again for your time.
